Package eu.aspire_fp7.adss.ga

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    FitnessFunction<T>
    The fitness function for a genetic algorithm.
    As a rule of thumb, the higher the fitness value the better a chromosome is.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClearingFunction<T>
    A clearing function for a genetic algorithm.
    CrossoverFunction<T>
    A crossover function for a genetic algorithm.
    DoublePointCrossover<T>
    Double-point crossover function.
    GeneticAlgorithm<T>
    A genetic algorithm implementation.
    In a nutshell: T is a gene; List<T> is a gene list; List<List<T>> is a chromosome. In a chromosome the gene lists are separated from each other, so that a gene in a list cannot be placed in another list.
    MutationFunction<T>
    A mutation function for a genetic algorithm.
    OrderedSelection<T>
    The ordered selection method with replacement.
    The probability of a chromosome to be select is proportional to its position in the sorted list of all individual in the population.
    RankSelection<T>
    The rank selection method with replacement.
    The probability of a chromosome to be selected is proportional to its rank.
    RouletteWheelSelection<T>
    The roulette wheel selection method with replacement.
    The probability of a chromosome to be selected is proportional to its fitness.
    SelectionFunction<T>
    A selection function for a genetic algorithm.
    SinglePointCrossover<T>
    Single-point crossover function.
    StallFunction<T>
    A termination criteria based on the stall of the fitness values.
    This function terminates the evolution when the delta of the last best fitness values has not increased enough.
    StandardClearing<T>
    Standard clearing function.
    Basically the population is divided in sub-populations, then the fitness of all but some best individuals for each sub-population is set to negative infinity.
    StandardMutation<T>
    Standard mutation function.
    TerminationFunction<T>
    A termination function.
    TournamentSelection<T>
    The tournament selection method with replacement.
    We pick a sub-set of the population and the chromosome in here are selected according to their fitness.
    TruncationSelection<T>
    The truncation selection method with replacement.
    The highest fitness chromosomes are selected and copied several times until the mating pool is full.
